values.description:
The goal here is to use the official brew tools a bit more, and it eliminates some of the custom code we were using for updating bottle hashes. In order to do this, it's much easier if the bottles all have the same `root_url`, so I've changed it to http://gazebosim.org/distributions/bottles-simulation in the bottle creation script, which passes it to `brew test-bot`. The root_url is then saved in the bottle json files, which are used by `brew bottle --merge --write` to update the bottle hashes. The json files are also used by the repository_uploader to know where to upload them.

I've tested this with the following pull request:

* https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/511
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/17/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/581/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/repository_uploader_ng/5958/
values.title: Use single root_url for brew bottles, use brew bottle --merge --write

values.description:
[This PR](https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/pull/827) will make `gazebo_ros_pkgs` depend on ROS 2 master (Crystal candidate), and there's no plan to keep supporting Bouncy, so I'm commenting out bouncy lines, but leaving them there so we could just replace them with crystal once we have some debs available.

FYI @nuclearsandwich

values.description:
While building bottles for the latest prerelease of ignition-rendering, it did not build bottles for sierra because that version of macOS is too old (see [`depends_on :macos` line in formula](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/blob/master/ignition-rendering1.rb#L14)).

* https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/518
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder&build=21)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/21/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/21/

That didn't cause any problems for `brew test-bot`, but we have a check in our build script that will fail if no bottles are built. This was a helpful check, but it should be relaxed now that we have some formulae that don't support old distros. This PR causes the script to exit without failure if no bottles are built. Testing:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder&build=22)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/22/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/22/

UPDATE:

The archive artifacts step complained in build 22, so I've updated the dsl, deployed it, and started another test:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder&build=23)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/23/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/23/

values.description:
After merging [#!/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/661/support-for-node-selection-in-debbuild/diff](#!/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/661/support-for-node-selection-in-debbuild/diff) a side effect is that the node selection mechanism is being propagated to th `repository_uploader` job \(which should only run in master\). This seems to me like  a bug already reported.

To avoid it, we can hardcode the `JENKINS_NODE_TAG`parameter to `master`when we call the repository\_uploader script.
values.title: Workaround to repository_uploader to avoid propagation of machine selection

This seems to me like  a bug already reported.

To avoid it, we can hardcode the `JENKINS_NODE_TAG`parameter to `master`when we call the repository\_uploader script.
summary.html:
After merging #!/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/661/support-for-node-selection-in-debbuild/diff a side effect is that the node selection mechanism is being propagated to th repository_uploader job (which should only run in master). This seems to me like a bug already reported.

To avoid it, we can hardcode the JENKINS_NODE_TAGparameter to masterwhen we call the repository_uploader script.

values.description:
The tinyxml2 7.0.0 formula is broken right now, so I've made a temporary tinyxml2@6.2.0 formula in our tap, but it is keg-only (it won't sym-link to /usr/local), so we need to add some extra paths to environment variables when this is detected as a dependency.

Without this, the ign-common default branch fails to configure the graphics component (which needs tinyxml2):

* only 127 tests: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_common-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/118/testReport/

With this branch, it does build the graphics component:

* runs 157 tests: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_common-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/120/testReport/

values.description:
The `ign-gazebo` project name doesn't include its major version:

* https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/src/3696b763243aa1f54feeefc1745fb2486fb9de9c/CMakeLists.txt?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#CMakeLists.txt-6

This causes our homebrew build to fail when it can't detect the major version:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64&build=1)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/1/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/1/

We may decide to change the project name, but in the meantime, we should update our CI scripts to handle this case.

* 9906b10: don't fail the homebrew build if we fail to detect a major version, just try to continue without a major version in the project name and hope we can find a formula alias
* e648c8c: allow `detect_cmake_major_version.py` to detect major version from project VERSION if it's not appended to project name

With this branch, the build still fails but for an unrelated reason:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64&build=2)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/2/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/2/
values.title: Handle projects without major version in name

values.description:
Two fixes to help with false positives in the gazebo\_ros\_pkgs CI:

* Use COLCON\_IGNORE to avoid uncrustify to check files in that directories
* Back to source setup.bash to after rosdep install so we catch the local\_setup.bash files.

Tested twice:

* ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ros2_gazebo_pkgs-ci-default_crystal-bionic-amd64&build=15)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros2\_gazebo\_pkgs-ci-default\_crystal-bionic-amd64/15/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros2_gazebo_pkgs-ci-default_crystal-bionic-amd64/15/))


* ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ros2_gazebo_pkgs-ci-default_crystal-bionic-amd64&build=14)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros2\_gazebo\_pkgs-ci-default\_crystal-bionic-amd64/14/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros2_gazebo_pkgs-ci-default_crystal-bionic-amd64/14/))



In the unstable one there are two tests failing:

* gazebo\_ros `test_node` seems to disappear from execution without given a trace after the message `[INFO] [gazebo_ros_node]: ROS was initialized without arguments.`
* `gazebo_ros_ray_sensor_test`failed with what seems to be an error in the bitness of a null comparison used by gtest ASSERT\_NE\(pc, nullptr\) being pc a point cloud shared pointer `13: Expected: (pc) != (nullptr), actual: 16-byte object <00-00 00-00 00-00 00-00 00-00 00-00 00-00 00-00> vs 8-byte object <00-00 00-00 00-00 00-00>`

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros2_gazebo_pkgs-ci-default_crystal-bionic-amd64/14/)

In the unstable one there are two tests failing:

  • gazebo_ros test_node seems to disappear from execution without given a trace after the message [INFO] [gazebo_ros_node]: ROS was initialized without arguments.
  • gazebo_ros_ray_sensor_testfailed with what seems to be an error in the bitness of a null comparison used by gtest ASSERT_NE(pc, nullptr) being pc a point cloud shared pointer 13: Expected: (pc) != (nullptr), actual: 16-byte object <00-00 00-00 00-00 00-00 00-00 00-00 00-00 00-00> vs 8-byte object <00-00 00-00 00-00 00-00>
